Author: YesterShill

Comment: General Motors CEO Mary Barra kicked off her Q1 letter to shareholders by thanking “President Trump for his support of the U.S. automotive industry.” Several paragraphs later, things take a turn, with Barra projecting an impact of $4 billion to $5 billion as a result of Trump’s ever-changing tariffs.  Barra’s letter was evidence of the delicate line the automaker needs to tread in order to placate the president while also assuring investors that it can weather the financial storm ahead. And in that respect, GM says it has a lot of evidence in its favor.  Read more from Andrew Hawkins: [https://www.theverge.com/news/659491/gm-thanks-trump-for-the-5-billion-tariff-hit-it-expects-to-take](https://www.theverge.com/news/659491/gm-thanks-trump-for-the-5-billion-tariff-hit-it-expects-to-take)
Author: theverge
